From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>

As for unrealistic, during the gulf war how did american and Saudi missles
destroy Iraqui Scud missles? as soon as a hissle was fired it's warhead
would be active, virtually any impact would destroy it. (Optimal Optimus
would have NEVER been able to deflect Rampages missle simply by useing his
arm.) But the writers allowed it because it allowed them to destroy the
Maximal ship so the Maximals wouldn't have to defend it and the Ark at the
same time, a war on two fronts would've weakened the Maximals and since they
didn't really have a qualified leader for the second front they would've
lost the Beast Wars.

If anyone feels I abuse the rules then say so but since it's usually my
characters that end up looking like the wrong end of a collision with a mack
truck I personally don't feel I do. Blocking an attack should be legal as
long as it doesn't end up being EVERY attack. She shot down two missles and
an attack failed, logical solution- ATTACK AGAIN AND SEE WHAT HAPPENS.

I've already posted that Brandeds flamethrower can heat up like a blast
furnace, for those of you who haven't worked industry that would be anywhere
from 2000 to 5000 degrees  (Nothing compared to "Advanced" Transformer
technology.)  depending on whats being melted (Science note for those
interested) Brass has a melting point of 1800 degrees, copper slightly
lower.(Softer metal requires lower temperature.)

One last question- How is it that Arty and Pacifix are engaged in hand to
hand combat but Pacifix isn't being hit by any of the weapons fire being
used against Arty? We've got Slags flames, Artemiss' automatic weapons fire,
and whatever other attacks come his way. It's three on one people, IM each
other and get your attacks organized. By all rights Arty Should be toast.
(Burnt toast if Slag keeps eatin Jabernero peppers.)

 ----- Original Message -----
From: robertdahl <rdahl@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 31, 2001 7:53 AM
Subject: Re: The bum and the hole...


> OOC: Well I just need to ad my opinion, I think the rule of interception
> is pretty useless, and poorly thought out. IMH it is much more
> interesting sometimes to intercept than to just dodge when you think you
> dont want to accept dammage. And Jeff, in the show they did intercept,
> ussually missiles with gun fire, but sometimes more powerful rays
> against each other. Megatron and Dinobots laser war from Double Dinobot
> comes to mind. In the original series, Slag even ignited a missile with
> his flame breath before it reached him, and I'm not sure, but I think
> Inferno did it too.
